item.title: By: Maureen Coffey
item.dc:creator: Maureen Coffey
item.description: "philological humanities’ debilitation" ... Isn't it amazing that the US almost "single-handedly" kick-started modern linguistics by virtue of the seminal impulse from Chomsky's transformational grammar(s)? And how on the other hand still philology often languishes as a "descriptive" discipline in many departments? Computer science and computer translation have all shunned these departments because they have kind of hid in an ivory tower while the world around them was (still is) craving and begging for guidance in all matters language.
